thread.title: Linda McMahon Confirmed To Lead Small Business Administration
thread.title_full: Linda McMahon Confirmed To Lead Small Business Administration

author: Charles Campbell
title: Linda McMahon Confirmed To Lead Small Business Administration
text:
Linda McMahon Confirmed To Lead Small Business Administration "... a welcome change from Washington." by Charles Campbell February 14, 2017 at 10:58am Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
Former pro wresting executive Linda McMahon was confirmed by the Senate on Tuesday to lead the Small Business Administration. 
The Senate voted 81-19, with McMahon finding bipartisan support among her new colleagues. 
Majority Leader Mitch McConnell had nothing but good things to say about McMahon. Advertisement - story continues below 
“McMahon, who built a small company from the ground up, understands the many challenges small businesses can face,” he said. “She certainly came a long way from sharing a desk with her husband and leasing a typewriter.” 
McConnell added that McMahon will “prioritize growing jobs over growing government bureaucracy.” 
“In so many states, including mine, that’s a welcome change from Washington,” the Senate Republican leader said. Advertisement - story continues below 
McMahon served as the chief executive officer at World Wresting Entertainment Inc. before stepping down to run twice for the Senate in Connecticut. 
Two Senate Democrats, whom McMahon unsuccessfully ran against in 2012 and 2010, introduced her during the confirmation hearing. 
“[I’m] pleased to hear that Mrs. McMahon will serve as a passionate advocate for small businesses and that she believes the SBA should continue as a Cabinet-level, stand-alone agency,” Jeanne Shaheen, a top Democrat on the business panel, said. 
Connecticut Sen. Jim Risch, chairman of the Senate Committee on Small Businesses and Entrepreneurship, praised McMahon for her background , noting she has what it takes to help small businesses grow in America. Advertisement - story continues below
